Submodules

lab_marker.auto.ProcessHandler module

class lab_marker.auto.ProcessHandler.ProcessHandler(process_name: str, out_stream: StreamHandler, cwd=None)[source]

Bases: object

This class is used to create and handle processes run for evaluating labs. Processes are run using pexpect and the output of the processes are polled during runtime. Commands can also be sent to the process while it is running. Outputs of the processes are handled by a StreamHandler object.

get_output(timeout=0.1) → None[source]

Polls the process in 1000 byte chunks to get it’s output. If timeout is set to None, the read may block indefinitely. When the timeout is exceeded before filling the read buffer, a timeout event is raised. The content of the read buffer is written out using the outstream.

When trying to read from a terminated process, an error will be raised.

Parameters:

timeout – How long to wait for the buffer to fill

kill_process() → None[source]

Kill the process by force

send_command(command: str, get_output=True) → None[source]

Sends a command to the process to be executed. By default, the result of executing the command will be polled from the process.

Parameters:

  • command – The command to be sent to the process

  • get_output – If true, the process will be polled right after sending the command to get the output

write_to_out_stream(message: str) → None[source]

lab_marker.auto.StreamHandler module

class lab_marker.auto.StreamHandler.StreamHandler(file_name: str | None = None, open_mode='w', terminal_out=False)[source]

Bases: object

Handles writing to output streams such as files and the terminal. Can handle writing to multiple streams at once and have control over which streams to exclude as well.

close() → None[source]

Closes all opened output streams

write_message(message: str, no_print=False) → None[source]

Write the content inside message to the available streams.

Parameters:

  • message – A string that should be written to an output stream

  • no_print – Disables printing the output to the terminal
